# Extraction par lot de Firecrawl vers Google Docs
## Pour qui est-ce
D√©veloppeurs de chatbots IA, gestionnaires de contenu et analystes de donn√©es qui ont besoin d'extraire et d'organiser du contenu √† partir de plusieurs pages Web pour la cr√©ation de bases de connaissances, l'analyse concurrentielle ou les projets de migration de contenu.
## Ce que cela fait
Ce flux de travail extrait automatiquement le contenu d'une liste d'URL et convertit chaque page en un document Google structur√© au format markdown. Il est con√ßu pour le traitement par lot de plusieurs pages de mani√®re efficace, ce qui le rend id√©al pour la construction de bases de connaissances IA, l'analyse du contenu des concurrents ou la migration de contenu de site Web vers des syst√®mes de documentation.
## Comment cela fonctionne
Le flux de travail suit un processus d'extraction syst√©matique :

Entr√©e d'URL : Lit une liste d'URL √† partir d'un mod√®le Google Sheets

### √âtape 2 : Configurez les identifiants API

### √âtape 3 : Configurez votre dossier Google Drive

Dossier par d√©faut : "Contenu scrap√©"
ID du dossier : 1ry3xvQ9UqM2Rf9C4-AoJdg1lfB9inh_5 (personnalisez ceci pour votre propre dossier)

Option B : D√©clencheur manuel

## Comment personnaliser le flux de travail
### Personnalisation de la source d'URL

Nom de la feuille : Changez "Page vers doc" par le nom de votre onglet pr√©f√©r√©
Structure de colonne : Modifiez les mappages de champs si vous utilisez des noms de colonnes diff√©rents

### Configuration de l'extraction

Options Firecrawl : Ajoutez des param√®tres d'extraction sp√©cifiques (temps d'attente, rendu JavaScript)

### Personnalisation de la sortie

## Cas d'utilisation
### Cr√©ation de base de connaissances IA

Pages de produits e-commerce : Extraire des descriptions de produits et des sp√©cifications pour la formation de chatbots
Sites de documentation : Convertir des articles d'aide en contenu structur√© de base de connaissances

### Analyse et migration de contenu

Recherche concurrentielle : Analyser le contenu et la structure des sites Web concurrents

Migrations de sites Web : Sauvegarder le contenu avant les refontes de site ou les changements de plateforme

### Recherche et documentation

Recherche de march√© : Collecter des informations √† partir de plusieurs sources industrielles
Recherche acad√©mique : Rassembler du contenu √† partir de sources Web pertinentes
Conformit√© l√©gale : Documenter les termes, politiques et avertissements du site Web

Pr√©vention des doublons : Ignore les URL d√©j√† marqu√©es comme "Scrap√©"

Mises √† jour de progr√®s : Mises √† jour de statut en temps r√©el dans la feuille de calcul source

### Gestion des erreurs et r√©silience

√âchecs gracieux : Continue le traitement des URL restantes si des extractions individuelles √©chouent

## Interpr√©tation des r√©sultats

### Suivi des progr√®s
La feuille de calcul source montre :

Colonne de statut : "OK" pour compl√©t√©, vide pour en attente
Mises √† jour en temps r√©el : Progr√®s visible pendant l'ex√©cution du flux de travail

## Limitations du flux de travail

Traitement s√©quentiel : Traite les URL une √† la fois (√©vite la limitation de taux mais plus lent pour de grandes listes)
D√©pendance √† Google Drive : N√©cessite Google Drive pour le stockage des documents

Pas de d√©-duplication de contenu : Cr√©e des documents s√©par√©s m√™me pour un contenu similaire

parameters.content:
### What you do:

Provide the Google Sheets URL containing the list of URLs to scrape
Ensure your spreadsheet has a "Page to doc" sheet with URL column populated
Trigger the workflow by submitting the spreadsheet link via chat interface

### What the system does:

Receives the spreadsheet URL via webhook trigger
Prepares the system for bulk URL processing
Sets up the workflow for automated scraping and document generation

### Result:
‚úÖ Workflow initialized with your URL list
‚úÖ System prepared for bulk processing
‚úÖ Secure connection established to your spreadsheet
‚úÖ Ready to begin automated scraping sequence

### What the system does:

Connects to your Google Sheets document
Reads the "Page to doc" sheet to extract URL list
Retrieves all URLs marked for processing
Loads scraping status to track progress

### Result:
‚úÖ Complete URL inventory loaded from spreadsheet
‚úÖ Processing queue established
‚úÖ Status tracking system activated
‚úÖ Data structure prepared for bulk operations

### What the system does:

Filters out empty rows to focus on valid URLs
Validates URL format and accessibility
Removes already processed URLs based on "Scraped" status
Creates clean dataset for processing

### Result:
‚úÖ Only valid, unprocessed URLs selected
‚úÖ Duplicate processing prevention implemented
‚úÖ Efficient resource utilization ensured
‚úÖ Clean processing queue established

### What the system does:

Checks scraping status for each URL
Identifies URLs without "Scraped" marker in the spreadsheet
Routes unprocessed URLs to the scraping pipeline
Skips already completed URLs to avoid redundant work

### Result:
‚úÖ Smart detection of pending work
‚úÖ Resume capability for interrupted processes
‚úÖ Progress tracking implemented
‚úÖ Efficient processing optimization

### What the system does:

Processes URLs one at a time to maintain stability
Manages processing queue systematically
Maintains data integrity throughout the workflow
Handles batch processing with controlled flow

### Result:
‚úÖ Organized sequential processing established
‚úÖ System stability maintained during bulk operations
‚úÖ Processing queue managed efficiently
‚úÖ Scalable approach for large URL lists

### What the system does:

Uses Firecrawl service to extract content from each URL
Retrieves full page content including text, metadata, and structure
Converts content to markdown format for clean document creation
Extracts page metadata such as titles and descriptions
Handles various page types and content structures
Implements retry logic for failed scraping attempts

### Result:
‚úÖ Complete page content extracted and formatted
‚úÖ Clean markdown conversion for document creation
‚úÖ Page metadata preserved for context
‚úÖ Reliable content extraction with error handling

### What the system does:

Creates individual Google Docs for each scraped page
Uses the page URL as filename for easy identification
Stores documents in designated folder ("Contenu scrap√©")
Formats content as markdown in the document
Preserves original page structure and formatting where possible

### Result:
‚úÖ Individual Google Docs created for each URL
‚úÖ Organized file storage in dedicated folder
‚úÖ Clear naming convention for easy navigation
‚úÖ Content preserved in accessible document format

### What the system does:

Updates the source spreadsheet with processing status
Marks completed URLs with "Scraped: OK" status
Maintains processing log for accountability
Enables resume functionality for interrupted workflows

### Result:
‚úÖ Real-time progress tracking in spreadsheet
‚úÖ Clear status indicators for all processed URLs
‚úÖ Resume capability for large processing jobs
‚úÖ Complete audit trail of scraping activities

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
